Issues.Title: Migrate `Shell32` enums to `Cswin32`
Issues.Body:
Migrates shell32 custom implemented enums to use ones generated from cswin32.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9909)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Migrate `Shell32` enums to `Cswin32`" (#9909)

Issues.Title: MethodInvoker Defined  in System.Windows.Forms and Reflection differently
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

The images are examples of a file using New MethodInvoker defined in System.Windows.Forms but Visual Studio does not think the include statement is needed (its grayed out) If you remove the Imports the program will fail to compile. 

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/12789369/25e869d1-f0e4-46c3-8130-d48c2f0b58b2)

If a function using MethodInvoker is copied Visual Studio will add an Imports to System.Reflection and says its required but it produces and error because System.Reflection does not have the needed New(AddresssOf x) overload.

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/12789369/15c911dc-d99e-417d-9942-08a3c5f3e384)


### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No idea

### Issue description

Use of New MethodInvoke is not handled correctly by Visual Studio, but I think it's due to a conflict between System.Refactoring and System.Windows.Forms which both define it with different overloads and System.Reflection is taking higher precedence.


### Steps to reproduce

Open ..winforms\src\Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms\tests\UnitTests\System\Windows\Forms\ControlTests.vb
Remove the unnecessary Imports System.Windows.Forms and you will get errors compiling.

Cut and then paste a line with New MethodInvoker and Imports System.Reflection will be added, and code will not compile dues to ambiguous definition of MethodInvoker.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MethodInvoker Defined  in System.Windows.Forms and Reflection differently" (#9885)

Issues.Title: Localized file check-in by OneLocBuild Task: Build definition ID 164: Build ID 2266632
Issues.Body:
This is the pull request automatically created by the OneLocBuild task in the build process to check-in localized files generated based upon translation source files (.lcl files) handed-back from the downstream localization pipeline. If there are issues in translations, visit https://aka.ms/icxLocBug and log bugs for fixes. The OneLocBuild wiki is https://aka.ms/onelocbuild and the localization process in general is documented at https://aka.ms/AllAboutLoc.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Localized file check-in by OneLocBuild Task: Build definition ID 164: Build ID 2266632" (#9908)

Issues.Title: Update LocProj to help CI verification
Issues.Body:
We ported DataGridviewDesigner via https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9677 in main branch but failed to update stored LocProj file to reflect the resource content that came with this porting.

Fixing issue in CI https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_build/results?buildId=2266578&view=logs&j=c2111129-d6a3-58de-e667-00e5a0966c99&t=04624205-1088-500d-206a-392ceb108efa with this update.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9907)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update LocProj to help CI verification" (#9907)

Issues.Title: THIRD-PARTY-NOTICES.txt file contains test-only notices
Issues.Body:
Test-only notices should **not** be included in the main repo's TPN file: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/THIRD-PARTY-NOTICES.TXT

Please remove this notice and include it alongside tests that need it. See this as an example: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/src/tests/JIT/Performance/CodeQuality/Burgers/THIRD-PARTY-NOTICES

This issue was uncovered while updating TPN file for .NET 8 release: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/91933 The process assembles notices from all repos into a shared TPN file that ships with SDK.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "THIRD-PARTY-NOTICES.txt file contains test-only notices" (#9905)

Issues.Title: Place Test-Only Notice Alongside Test
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9905 

Removes the test-only notice in the main repo's TPN and add it alongside the test that utilizes it in a local TPN

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9906)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Place Test-Only Notice Alongside Test" (#9906)

Issues.Title: Migrate TaskDialogIndirect to CsWin32
Issues.Body:
Related: #9825

We are waiting on some Win32MetaData changes to bubble into CsWin32 before I can complete this.

Currently blocked by https://github.com/microsoft/CsWin32/pull/1020 which added `BOOL.ToString` clashing with our implementation but returning the hex value as a string instead of True/False.

Issues.Title: Fix Misdefined P/Invoke GetExitCodeThread
Issues.Body:
In .NET 7, we had gotten a report for WinForms application hanging on exit and found that due to changes to SystemEvent thread, it exposed a P/Invoke that was misdefined on our end. The fix for this has been serviced for .NET 7 (https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9861). Although we haven't received a customer report nor do we have issues in the exact same scenario that we had gotten in .NET 7, given that the P/Invoke definition is misdefined in the same way and we are checking the error code it returns, issues around this P/Invoke being misdefined may resurface in other code paths.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9883)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix Misdefined P/Invoke GetExitCodeThread" (#9883)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in MemberCodeDomSerializer and all derived classes
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in `MemberCodeDomSerializer`
- Enable nullability in `EventMemberCodeDomSerializer`
- Enable nullability in `PropertyMemberCodeDomSerializer`
- Enable nullability in `ResourcePropertyMemberCodeDomSerializer`, remove an unused field and rename another field

Issues.Title: Add unit test for PropertyGridView.DropDownHolder.cs
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Related to #3136


## Proposed changes

- Add unit tests for PropertyGridView.DropDownHolder.cs

## Regression? 

-  No

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

Issues.Title: The TreeView incorrectly scale on the high DPI devices in VB platform
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 6.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

The item text is cut inside the TreeView in high DPI.
See shortcut:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/23306796/087896e2-6c91-46cc-aba9-16860ca6eebd)
It works in .net framework 4.7 : (change the<TargetFramework></TargetFramework> from net6.0-windows to net47)
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/23306796/4671c864-d903-4237-a2fd-4e9bec439c14)

The test code:
[TreeViewSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/12574754/TreeViewSample.zip)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a VB form App(net 6.0) and place a TreeView. Fill in some content, for example, the paths under "C:\"
2. build the project
3. Set the DPI to 225%
4. Run the app
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The TreeView incorrectly scale on the high DPI devices in VB platform" (#9881)
